definition: Ming Taizu, Temple name of first Ming emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
ancestor/forefather/grandparents
surname Zu

sentences.english: This hill, Tomb of Emperor Zhu.
Zhu Yuanzhang, founder of Ming Dynasty, granted it the High Mountain Lu.
sentences.chinese: 明太祖朱元璋还曾封庐山为“庐岳”。

sentences.english: A legend in his family says one ancestor used to be a monk and beggar, which is very similar to the deeds of Zhu Yuanzhang, the first emperor of Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这个传说与明太祖朱元璋极其相似。

sentences.english: The third contributes to Ming Taizhu promotion to advice.
sentences.chinese: 三是明太祖提倡直言的影响。

definition: Ming Chengzu, Temple name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Zhu Yuanzhang, personal name of first Ming dynasty emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
Hongwu Emperor, also written Hung-wu Ti, reign name of first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1] (1328-1398), reigned 1386-1398, Temple name 明太祖[Ming2 Tai4 zu3]
Zhu Di, personal name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
reign name of second Ming emperor, reigned 1398-1402, deposed in 1402
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)
tomorrow morning/the following morning
Temple name of fifth Ming emperor Xuande 宣德[Xuan1 de2]
Great Ancestor (posthumous title, e.g. for the founder of a dynasty)
Ming Wuzong, temple name of eleventh Ming emperor Zhengde 正德[Zheng4 de2]
Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
Emperor Taizu of Song, posthumous title of the founding Song emperor Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 (927-976), reigned from 960
reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)
Ming Renzong, Temple name of fourth Ming emperor Zhu Gaochi 朱高熾|朱高炽[Zhu1 Gao1 chi4]
reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
the early Ming (i.e. from second half of 14th century)
lit. progenitor of the Yuan Dynasty (1279-1368), title of Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
